definition: Types of support provided to learners to facilitate learning, engagement, and success

positive_examples: The tutor provided both cognitive and emotional support throughout the session.
Effective support addresses not just content confusion but also motivation and confidence.
Scaffolding, encouragement, and accessibility accommodations are all forms of learner support.
Good tutoring means meeting learners where they are and providing what they need to progress.
negative_examples: The lecture covered the required material.
The textbook was assigned for homework.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active support for learners, not just content delivery

simplex_mapping.mapping_rationale: Learner support ultimately aims to build learner independence
